Capital Expenditure.definition: an amount paid out that creates a long-term benefit

1.1: an amount paid out that creates a long-term benefit (as one lasting beyond the taxable year)

2.1: costs that are incurred in the acquisition or improvement of property (as capital assets) or that are otherwise chargeable to a capital account
2.note: Capital expenditures are not deductible for income tax purposes. They are generally added to the property's basis.
